thread.section_title: The Wall Street Journal & Breaking News, Business, Financial and Economic News, World News and Video
thread.title: Pennsylvania Governor Rejects GOP’s Proposed New Congressional Districts

author: Scott Calvert
title: Pennsylvania Governor Rejects GOP’s Proposed New Congressional Districts
text:
Pennsylvania’s Democratic governor on Tuesday rejected a proposed congressional map drawn up by Republican legislative leaders to address political imbalances cited last month by the state’s Supreme Court.
“The analysis by my team shows that, like the 2011 map, the map submitted to my office by Republican leaders is still a gerrymander,” Gov. Tom Wolf said in a statement. “Their map clearly seeks to benefit one political party, which is the essence of why the court found the current map to be unconstitutional.”
... RELATED VIDEO Is Extreme Gerrymandering Unconstitutional? A ​Supreme Court case on gerrymandering — the practice of drawing district boundaries for political advantage — could reshape the country’s political landscape. Critics say the partisan redistricting undermines representative democracy. Video/Photo: Madeline Marshall/WSJ.
